intro: Hieracium albocomosum, commonly known as the white-haired hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow with white ray florets. It is an annual or biennial plant, often found in disturbed habitats.
